message.content:
cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.AI, cs.CE 

This paper discusses energy-efficient cloud control and pricing in geographically distributed data centers. It involves the optimization of resource allocation and hardware configuration in response to geotemporal inputs, which are related to network infrastructure and system performance. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses pricing schemes that account for computational resource availability and costs, which suggests that it may also belong to the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-category. The paper also proposes a pervasive cloud control approach that considers the quality of service (QoS) impact of cloud control actions, which may place it in the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category. Furthermore, the paper proposes novel pricing schemes that account for energy costs, which may suggest that it belongs to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. Finally, the paper evaluates its methods empirically and in simulations, which may suggest that it belongs to the Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science (cs.CE) sub-category.
